intro: Dryandra vestita, commonly known as the slender dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, wiry stems and narrow, leathery leaves. It is adapted to the nutrient-poor soils of its native habitat and requires well-drained conditions. The flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and they bloom in spring.
